CatDescriptText: Fred Mamula, student, Aliquippa and James Sheffey, hearing aid salesman, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 15, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that the Pirates will lose any cash customers in 1961 because of the way the World Series tickets were..."  Mr. Mamula's answer reads: "Pittsburgh area people are good fans and they will be back next year."  Mr. Sheffey's answer reads: "No, not hardly.  I think the distribution was rather fair.  You can't please everybody."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Fred Mamula wearing varsity jacket with leather sleeves and football shaped patch inscribed "Conference 1959 Champs," standing in front of KQV radio, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of James Sheffey wearing striped suit jacket and hat, standing in front of KQV radio, Smithfield Street, Downtown
